job_history.work_description: Oversee and delegate responsibilities to a 5 LVN, 4 RT and 4 CNA staff on a 53 bed sub-acute unit to insure proper adherence to facility policies and procedures. Perform complete comprehensive assessments on all admissions, re-admissions and current residents. Initiate, maintain and administer all intravenous therapies as ordered per facility protocol. Manage and monitor residents' skin conditions to prevent breakdown and provide complete wound care as needed. Relay any significant change of condition, laboratory work and client concerns to physician and responsible party. Advocate for each client through professional intuition, proficient interdisciplinary communication, and family and patient teaching. Provide specialized care for residents status post varying degrees of complex surgical procedures including delicate respiratory issues such as tracheotomy and mechanical ventilation cares. Compose comprehensive care plans in accordance with evidence-based research, the client's medical history and personal nurse to client interaction. Manage daily schedule to ensure that unit is safely and appropriately staffed. Conduct team in-services to inform and educate staff on changes in company policies and/or address any recent concerns.

Assist patients with healing and recovery after surgery. Lead an in-service regarding proper use of responsible for the delivery of safe patient care utilizing the nursing process of assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation. Provide care for patients of different acuity levels ranging from medical-surgical to intensive care. Initiate and maintain cardiac drips, PCA pumps He/She communicates with the physician about changes in the patient's clinical condition including hemodynamic monitoring, results of diagnostic studies and abnormal results and symptomatology.

Performed complete comprehensive assessments on all admissions, re-admissions and current residents. Reviewed clients' medical histories, test results and electronic medication administration records for safe dispensation of medications and care. Assisted residents with their activities of daily living. Provided specific and individualized care for adults, status post varying degrees of surgical procedures. Composed comprehensive care plans in accordance with evidence-based research, the client's medical history and personal nurse to client interaction. Advocated for each client through professional intuition, proficient interdisciplinary communication, and family and patient teaching.

Verified correct client information and kindly and professionally interacted with each client before his/her radiology exam. Answered client questions about his/her particular health test. Securely transported patients safely and timely to and from the Emergency Department and their designated radiology examinations using wheelchairs or stretchers.

Monitored the Fitness Center and ensured that only students and faculty/staff members exercised in the gym. Organized and distributed athletic uniforms and equipment. Arlington Echo Outdoor Education Center Assistant - planting vegetation that is indigenous to Maryland and caring for animal tanks/habitats.

education.university: University of Maryland, Baltimore School of Nursing

skills.name: Nursing
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience as a Registered Nurse, with a strong background in patient care, assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has experience in supervising and delegating responsibilities to a team of healthcare professionals, suggesting strong proficiency in leadership.

skills.name: Patient Assessment
skills.explanation: Has performed comprehensive assessments on patients and residents, demonstrating expert-level mastery in patient assessment.

skills.name: Care Planning
skills.explanation: Has composed comprehensive care plans in accordance with evidence-based research, indicating expert-level mastery in care planning.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Has experience in communicating with patients, families, and healthcare professionals, suggesting strong proficiency in communication.

skills.name: Time Management
skills.explanation: Has managed daily schedules to ensure safe and appropriate staffing, suggesting strong proficiency in time management.

skills.name: Team Management
skills.explanation: Has experience in leading and educating teams of healthcare professionals, suggesting strong proficiency in team management.

skills.name: Patient Education
skills.explanation: Has experience in educating patients and families on healthcare topics, suggesting strong proficiency in patient education.

skills.name: Medical Records Management
skills.explanation: Has reviewed clients' medical histories and electronic medication administration records, showing solid working proficiency in medical records management.

skills.name: Transportation
skills.explanation: Has experience in transporting patients safely and timely, but this skill is not as prominent in the provided work history, suggesting some practical experience.
